page.title: 18The AA Building_Basingstoke
page.content: In November 1973 Her Majesty{Queen {Elizabeth 2nd}opened the AA Headquarters. It is the{tallest {building}between London and New York. The{architects}were Farmer and Dark butit was built by Bovis Construction. It took over 2 years to build at a cost of 4.5 million pounds. There are 850{company vehicles}and enough spaces to park 250 visitors' and employees'{cars.}There are 3300 {breakdown patrol vehicles. There are 1148 shrubs and trees around the building. There are 18 floors,7 lifts, 306 stairs,1287 windows and 1127 doors. There are 680 female staff sharing 2 to 3 thousand{telephones. There are almost 6 million{members}of the AA and the Association's{motto}is Courtessy and Care. The main work is to help{motorists}who break down on the{Highway}and get them on their way.
